forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4am. Cloudy, with a low around 56. South wind 3 to 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain between 8am and 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 3 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the early hours of the morning, Downtown San Francisco finds itself nestled under a quilt of clouds, whispering the possibility of rain before the dawn breaks. As the clock ticks toward morning light, the air feels cool and damp with a breath of southern wind, carrying the promise of a gentle drizzle. The temperature hovers comfortably around fifty-six degrees, encapsulating the city in a soft embrace, yet hinting at the chill that often lingers in winter's wake. 

As Monday unfolds, expect a lingering grayscape, with glimpses of clouds shifting in the light. Though the chance for rain ebbs as the day progresses, its shadow remains, casting a slight chance of precipitation throughout the hours of late morning and afternoon. Pleasantly brisk air invites layers; a light jacket and scarf are ample companions for a stroll through the streets, where the muted colors of the city meld into a soft monochrome. Plan your day to wander through quieter corners of the Bay, perhaps a visit to a cozy café or a leisurely perusal of local shops, all while the world looks on, wrapped in its fog-kissed mystery.
